unnormalised: ## Rental Agreements: Don't Get Nailed, Yaar!
normalised: ## Rental Agreements: Don't Get Nailed, Yaar!

unnormalised: Mumbai – Landlords, tenants, listen up! Things are heating up in the rental market, and that old "chalta hai" attitude towards rental agreements isn't gonna cut it anymore. Especially after that whole Sharma family fiasco in Bandra last month!
normalised: Mumbai – Landlords, tenants, listen up! Things are heating up in the rental market, and that old "chalta hai" attitude towards rental agreements isn't gonna cut it anymore. Especially after that whole Sharma family fiasco in Bandra last month!

unnormalised: Dr. Patil from the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) warns everyone to get proper agreements drafted. Forget those handwritten notes; you need it all in black and white: rent amount (Rs. 25,000 per month, anyone?), deposit amount, maintenance charges, the whole shebang!
normalised: Doctor Patil from the R E R A warns everyone to get proper agreements drafted. Forget those handwritten notes; you need it all in black and white: rent amount (rupee twenty five thousand per month, anyone?), deposit amount, maintenance charges, the whole shebang!

unnormalised: Plus, clearly state responsibilities – who fixes the leaky taps and who's in charge of the *bijli* bill. Remember Mrs. Iyer's 800 sq ft flat dispute? Nobody wants that kinda drama.
normalised: Plus, clearly state responsibilities – who fixes the leaky taps and who's in charge of the *bijli* bill. Remember Mistress Iyer's eight hundred square feet flat dispute? Nobody wants that kinda drama.

unnormalised: Even if you're renting to your best friend Ramesh, a solid agreement protects everyone. Legal fees are way cheaper than fighting in court later, trust me! So, get it done, avoid the *jhanjhat*, and keep your rental dreams alive! Get a lawyer, folks! It's worth the Rs. 5000 or so.
normalised: Even if you're renting to your best friend Ramesh, a solid agreement protects everyone. Legal fees are way cheaper than fighting in court later, trust me! So, get it done, avoid the *jhanjhat*, and keep your rental dreams alive! Get a lawyer, folks! It's worth the rupee five thousand or so.
